intro: Phaseolus pisiformis, commonly known as the kidney bean plant, is a species of flowering plant in the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to the Americas and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and pods that contain edible kidney-shaped beans. The plant typically grows to a height of 1–2 meters and thrives in warm, temperate climates. Its flowers are usually white or pale purple, and it is cultivated for its nutritious seeds. The plant also has a fibrous root system that helps in nitrogen fixation, benefiting soil fertility.
